Goddammit.

I mean I wouldn't call Aatrox "slow moving".

If Aatrox decides to press R and run directly at you, you're going to fight him whether you want to or not.
I'M FAST AS JHIN BOIIIIIIIIIIII
Until you shoot literally anything behind yourself at him and he gets slowed because the movement speed is out of combat only.

It's unconditional for the first second.

Combo that with Nimbus Cloak and maybe Ghostblade and you have one very fast boy.
If your close enough so 1 second of increased movement speed is going to catch you, you may have mispositioned.

That would be more relevant if he were using his ult while trying to escape, but it's different if he's initiating.

Thing is, he doesn't have to get on top of you with the ult.
He only has to get within 950 units, the max range of a Q-E combo, or 1125 units, the max range of an E-W combo.

Most champions don't have the range to stop him from that far away, and the speed boost is really quite significant.

Not only is it a large boost, it's a large **flat** boost.
This means that any % movement speed increases you have will multiply that value.

Say we're looking at a level 16 Aatrox with Nimbus Cloak, Tabi, celerity, and Ghostblade; not a terribly uncommon build.

345 base speed
240 from World Ender
40 from Ghostblade passive
45 from Tabi
100 from Nimbus Cloak during the second second.
+20% from Ghostblade active
+1.5% from Celerity

That Aatrox is moving at 814 movement speed, and is briefly moving at 936 with Nimbus Cloak on.

(345+240+40+45)1.215=814.05
(345+240+40+45+100)1.215=935.55

Unless there's somebody between him and his intended target, Aatrox is going to be going very, very fast.

Your ignoring the soft cap at 415 and 500 movement speed which would reduce that by ~15-20% at least. 

Secondly a level 18 aatrox with gostblade is going to die really fast running in with ult like that.

You'll be happy to know, none of them are my juggernauts, as I don't play juggernauts. My most played champs atm are Aurelion Sol, Jhin, Poppy, and Pyke. I just find it downright silly that someone would consider Urgot or Sion uber mobile, especially if you see how they work in practice.

 Urgot has a dash, yeah, but he also has it super telegraphed, can't go over walls, is pretty short, has a long cooldown, and he literally has an ability that slows him down. 

Sion's ult definitely shouldn't put him as a candidate of super mobile, considering the fact that it is his ultimate ability, and most of the time, he's not gonna be zooming around the Rift with Initial D playing in the background. 

The only one I'd consider mobile is Aatrox, as, if we're being serious, once he pops his ult, you're gonna be fighting him whether you want to or not. But at the same time, it's an ultimate ability on a decently long cooldown.

Playing actually mobile champs, you'll just step around these slowpokes. Also, if you're not being completely serious, why bother trying to prove yourself right? Sounds like lying, m8
